page.title: 09Fyfield Attractions
page.content: The White Hart, a timber-framed building constructed in 1444 as the Chantry House for Sir John Golafre, draws many Oxford students and their families. It is reputed to have a cavalier ghost. Mr. Howard the proprietor has established it as an excellent restaurant as well as a pub. Many local people use it. There is no overnight accommodation but people are recommended to Manor Farm, which is included in the Farm Holiday Guide. Visitors enjoy the fine trees and deep sense of history. The Baptist Chapel, along with 4 cottages, is cut off from the village by the bypass. It is over 150 years old. The congregation averages about 40 and consists of students and families not from Fyfield, but from a ten mile radius. The minister Mr. Aldridge is a part-time dental surgeon
